newsitem.title: NEPAL: Nepal PM to visit Britain to strengthen ties.
newsitem.headline: Nepal PM to visit Britain to strengthen ties.

text.p: Nepal's Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba will visit Britain next week to strengthen relations between the two countries, a foreign ministry statement said on Sunday.
"He will be in London between November 10 and 13 on an official visit at the invitation of the British Prime Minister John Major to discuss matters of bilateral interest," the statement said.
Deuba will then go to Rome for the World Food Summit this month, the statement added.
In London, Deuba will also meet British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind and Defence Secretary Michael Portillo, a Foreign Ministry official said.
He will address a seminar at the Confederation of British Industries on trade and investment in Nepal and invite British investers to the Himalayan kingdom, he said.
Deuba will also address the London School of Economics, where he underwent special training in economics.

Britain is a major aid donor to Nepal, one of the world's 10 poorest countries which gets more than 60 percent of the cost of economic development from Western donors including multilateral agencies like the World Bank.
Initially, British assistance to Nepal was half grant and half soft term lending. In 1976, London decided to make all its future aid to Nepal as a non-refundable grant.
